item.title: Socks Proxy From Everywhere in the World
item.description: Ever wonder if you can use your raspberry pi/ec2/any kind of ssh instance as a proxy? I had the same kind of thought as part of my awesome times with my old raspberry, and I‚Äôve found a simple method to make any ssh server into a sock proxy. We‚Äôll start by running the following command: ssh -D 3213 -C -N user@host.com -p 22 little argument explanation: D ‚Äì Port the sock proxy going to bind in the localhost C ‚Äì Compresses the data before sending it (pretty cool if you ask me) N- Create a ‚Äòsilent session‚Äô, where nothing is being sent nor receive(great for this usage).
